summary: This document is a response from Capital One Bank to a subpoena issued by the FBI regarding information related to the Epstein case. It outlines the bank's objections to the subpoena, including issues of legal entity identification and the relevance of the requested information. The document also includes a declaration certifying the authenticity of the business records provided.

persons.name: SA Young
persons.context: SA Young is referenced as the recipient of the subpoena response from Capital One.

persons.name: Declarant
persons.context: The Declarant certifies the authenticity of the business records provided by Capital One in response to the subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A Grand Jury subpoena was issued to Capital One by an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) in relation to the Epstein case.

locations: Capital One Bank (USA), N.A., 75000 Capital One Drive, Richmond, VA 23238-7119
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: Capital One objects to the subpoena on several grounds, including incorrect legal entity identification and relevance of the requested information.
The document states that Capital One has a 7-year retention policy for account records.
No application, signature card, or identification used to open the account was located, and no IP history was found for the account closed in 2013.
The Declarant certifies that the documents provided are true and accurate duplicates of the original business records maintained by Capital One.
Capital One is voluntarily providing the records to the government as directed by the subpoena.
